00027 #include <GisCommon.h>

00033 /// \brief
00034 /// The GisICurveSegmentAbstract class is an abstract geometric Curve Segment object.  
00035 /// This class is used strictly as a component of curves 
00036 /// and, thus, does not inherit from IGeometry.
00037 class GisICurveSegmentAbstract : public GisIDisposable
00038 {
00039 public:
00040 
00041     /// \brief
00042     /// Gets the envelope for the curve segment.
00043     /// 
00044     /// \return
00045     /// Returns the envelope
00046     /// 
00047     GISGEOM_API virtual GisIEnvelope* GetEnvelope() const = 0;
00048 
00049     /// \brief
00050     /// Gets the starting position of this curve segment.
00051     /// 
00052     /// \return
00053     /// Returns the starting position
00054     /// 
00055     GISGEOM_API virtual GisIDirectPosition* GetStartPosition() const = 0;
00056 
00057     /// \brief
00058     /// Gets the ending position of this curve segment.
00059     /// 
00060     /// \return
00061     /// Returns the ending position
00062     /// 
00063     GISGEOM_API virtual GisIDirectPosition* GetEndPosition() const = 0;
00064 
00065     /// \brief
00066     /// Gets the closure state for the curve segment.
00067     /// 
00068     /// \remarks
00069     /// The meaning behind this method is not guaranteed
00070     /// to be uniform between derived types or between implementations
00071     /// of this package.
00072     /// It may represent a computed value, an explicit attribute, or be true by definition.
00073     /// As a computed value, the result is typically from simply testing the starting and 
00074     /// ending positions for exact equality.  This is only reliable in floating
00075     /// point arithmetic if these data have identical origins.
00076     /// As an explicit attribute, it would be persisted with the Geometry and 
00077     /// typically denoted by a parameter in the relevant factory method.  
00078     /// Some Geometry types are closed by definition.
00079     /// 
00080     /// \return
00081     /// Returns 'true' if the curve is closed, and false otherwise
00082     /// 
00083     GISGEOM_API virtual bool GetIsClosed() const = 0;
00084 
00085     /// \brief
00086     /// Gets the type of the most-derived interface 
00087     /// in the Geometry package for this object
00088     /// 
00089     /// \return
00090     /// Returns the derived type
00091     /// 
00092     GISGEOM_API virtual GisGeometryComponentType GetDerivedType() const = 0;
00093 
00094     /// \brief
00095     /// Gets the dimensionality of ordinates in this object.
00096     /// 
00097     /// \remarks
00098     ///  Values are from the GisDimensionality enumeration.
00099     /// A return type of "GisInt32" is used instead of the enumeration, catering to typical use with bit masking.
00100     /// 
00101     /// \return
00102     /// Returns the ordinate dimensionality
00103     /// 
00104     GISGEOM_API virtual GisInt32 GetDimensionality() const = 0;
00105 
00106 protected:
00107 
00108     /// \brief
00109     /// Default destructor.
00110     /// 
00111     /// \return
00112     /// Returns nothing
00113     /// 
00114     GISGEOM_API virtual ~GisICurveSegmentAbstract() {};
00115 
00116 };
00117 
00118 
00119 /// \brief
00120 ///  The GisCurveSegmentCollection class is a collection of CurveSegment objects.
00121 class GisCurveSegmentCollection : public GisCollection<GisICurveSegmentAbstract, GisException>
00122 {
00123 public:
00124     /// \brief
00125     ///  Creates an instance of GisCurveSegmentCollection with no contained elements.
00126     /// 
00127     /// \return
00128     /// Returns an empty collection
00129     /// 
00130     static GisCurveSegmentCollection* Create()
00131     {
00132         GisCurveSegmentCollection* value = new GisCurveSegmentCollection();
00133         if (NULL == value)
00134             throw GisException::Create(GisException::NLSGetMessage(GIS_NLSID(GIS_1_BADALLOC)));
00135 
00136         return value;
00137     }
00138 
00139 protected:
00140     void Dispose()
00141     {
00142         delete this;
00143     }
00144 };
